intro: Cayaponia multiglandulosa, commonly known as the Mexican cayaponia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
